suffdict.name: N2Vcha
suffdict.comment: HVY:98 rarely attaches to verb roots, see yati
a noun root that takes this cha should continue on to an optional vI2 etc.

+cha seems to attach to nouns and adjectives to verbalize them (causative)
uta+cha(ña) = make a house junt'u+cha(ña) = to heat (to make warm) yati+cha(ña) = to teach (cause to know) waña+cha(ña) = to dry llamp'u+cha = moler, pulverizar waqi+cha = repartir
llamp'u = sebo de llama, blando, fino, pulverizado, bien molido llamp'u+cha = moler, pulverizar
waqi = parte/porción waqi+cha = repartir
All in CALA orthography:
yupaychaNa = honrar wawa = baby wawachaNa = parir (give birth of animals) wawachasiNa = dar a luz (give birth of people)
waña = seco (dry) wañachaña = secar (to dry) wañachasiña = secarse
juri = mojado juricha(ña) = mojar
alternative to Jorje
waquichaNa = to prepare waquichaTa = prepared
uywa = domesticated animal uywachaña = adoptar, criar
uta = house utachaña = build a house
